Event.name: Breaking_off
Event.definition:
<def-root>An single <fen>Subpart</fen> breaks off from a <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex><fex name="sub">The original sword</fex> may have <t>chipped</t> <fex name="Whole">off of the statue</fex> <fex name="Time">long ago</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Subpart
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The part of the <fen>Whole</fen> that is conceived as being broken or taken off from the remaining part of the whole.
<ex><fex name="Sub_part">The handle</fex> <t>broke</t> off of the pot.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Whole
Arg.definition: <def-root>The piece that is presented in a less prominent position, and which is the landmark or remaining whole from which <fen>Sub_part</fen> breaks off. <ex>The handle <t>broke</t> <fex name="who">off of the pot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Criterion
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses a property of the Parts or components of the <fen>Whole</fen> which correlates with the locations (e.g.) of fragmentation on the <fen>Whole</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the breaking off of the <fen>Sub_part</fen> happens.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the breaking off occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event or participants not covered by more specific Frame Elements.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action, event, or state that enables the event of breaking off.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: chip.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: break off, especially a small piece.

lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fall off of or separate from

lexUnit.name: snap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: break quickly, often with a sharp sound (off of an object).
